meanings.definition: Not liked or approved by many people.
meanings.sent1: The new rule was unpopular among the students.
meanings.sent2: The movie was unpopular with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating broccoli ice cream sounded unpopular.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion choices were as unpopular as wearing socks with sandals.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs was as unpopular as a rainy day at the beach.

meanings.sent1: The candidate's speech was unpopular among the voters.
meanings.sent2: The book was unpopular at the book club.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pickle-flavored cake seemed unpopular at the party.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were as unpopular as a flat tire on a road trip.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine was as unpopular as a cold shower in winter.
